meanings.definition: Not modern; belonging to or characteristic of an earlier period.
meanings.sent1: The old house had a nonmodern look with its vintage furniture.
meanings.sent2: The antique clock was a nonmodern piece that added charm to the room.
meanings.sent3: Grandma's nonmodern recipe for apple pie always brings back memories.
meanings.sent4: The nonmodern architecture of the castle transported visitors to a different era.
meanings.sent5: The nonmodern painting captured the essence of a bygone time.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is not modern in style or design.
meanings.sent1: The collector loved to find nonmodern treasures at flea markets.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed various nonmodern artifacts from ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The nonmodern car attracted attention with its unique retro design.
meanings.sent4: She considered herself a nonmodern in a world of fast-paced technology.
meanings.sent5: The nonmodern fashion trend made a comeback on the runway.
